Did you hear that Thorpe Elementary School has adopted a Koala bear?! #adoptakoala

Lucy won't be roaming the hallways in Danvers, but she will have her food, shelter, and medical expenses supported for a full YEAR!

Thank you to the Thorpe Student Council for their ‚ÄúWild for Kindness‚Äù theme day & Australian Koala Foundation fundraiser that drew support from our generous students and staff.

Here is a description of Lucy, provided by her family at the Ballarat Wildlife Park:

Lucy is a mischievous girl who prefers to keep an eye on you from her vantage point, up high on the perching. She is great at acrobatics and can often be found swinging along the branches by only her front arms. And, she will always hang around for a delicious leafy treat.

But we realize this also can cause anxiety for some of us, for many different reasons. In honor of #mentalhealthmonth we want to share some tips for mask related anxiety.
1) Identify what‚Äôs causing the anxiety... talk it through with someone you can open up to.
2) Take a few deep breaths to calm your body.
3) Find a comfortable mask, maybe with a funny pattern!
4) Practice wearing it around your home to adjust to the new feeling.
5) Focus on the positives; this mask provides a layer of protection between you and others, and allows you to be safer while in public.

We know times have been stress and anxiety-inducing for many people lately. We are starting this week off with a #MindfulMonday activity.
This is a grounding technique. It can be used in a moment where you feel overwhelmed or panicked. Here is how it works:
Start by taking a slow, deep breath in, and then release all the air in your lungs as you breathe out. Continue these slow breaths while you identify the following:
FIVE things you can see... FOUR things you can touch... THREE things you can hear... TWO things you can smell... ONE thing you can taste.
The idea behind this technique is to quiet the stressful and unproductive thoughts, then bring your mind to a new focus, all while calming your body with intentional breathing. Please share with those you think could benefit!
